CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Prototype Development stage positioned above or below the Project Initiation stage?
SRP.A: The Prototype Development stage is positioned {below} the Project Initiation stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Design Phase?
VE.A: The value of stage Design Phase is {84%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Final Design Approval?
VE.A: The value of stage Final Design Approval is {34%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Prototype Development?
VE.A: The value of stage Prototype Development is {68%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Project Initiation, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Production, with a value of {19%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Project Initiation to stage Design Phase?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Project Initiation to stage Design Phase is {16%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 92%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 42%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Final Design Approval} stage has {34%}, the {Production} stage has {19%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 42% and 59%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Project Initiation to Design Phase, or from stage Final Design Approval to Production?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Project Initiation} to {Design Phase} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Design Phase to Prototype Development, or from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Prototype Development} to {Testing and Validation} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval, from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation, or from stage Final Design Approval to Production?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Prototype Development} to stage {Testing and Validation} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Prototype Development} and {Testing and Validation} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Final Design Approval} and {Production} stages.
